title: Python: Pandas CSV Clean & Export
description: Patrón básico para limpiar datos nulos en un DataFrame y exportar a un nuevo CSV limpio.
code:
import pandas as pd

# Cargar dataset
df = pd.read_csv('raw_data.csv')

# 1. Eliminar filas con valores nulos
df_clean = df.dropna()

# 2. Rellenar nulos específicos
df_clean['status'] = df_clean['status'].fillna('unknown')

# 3. Convertir columna de fecha
df_clean['created_at'] = pd.to_datetime(df_clean['created_at'])

# Exportar
df_clean.to_csv('clean_data.csv', index=False)
print(f'Procesadas {len(df_clean)} filas.')

title: SQL: Usuarios Activos (MAU)
description: Consulta estándar para calcular Usuarios Activos Mensuales (Monthly Active Users) basada en tabla de logins.
code:
SELECT 
    DATE_TRUNC('month', login_date) AS month,
    COUNT(DISTINCT user_id) AS active_users
FROM 
    user_logins
WHERE 
    login_date >= NOW() - INTERVAL '12 months'
GROUP BY 
    1
ORDER BY 
    1 DESC;

title: Bash: Script de Backup Simple
description: Script de shell para comprimir una carpeta y guardarla con fecha actual.
code:
#!/bin/bash

SOURCE="/var/www/html"
DEST="/backups"
DATE=$(date +%Y-%m-%d_%H-%M-%S)
ARCHIVE="backup-$DATE.tar.gz"

echo "Iniciando backup de $SOURCE..."
tar -czf $DEST/$ARCHIVE $SOURCE

echo "Backup completado: $DEST/$ARCHIVE"

title: SQL: Detectar Duplicados
description: Query para encontrar registros con emails duplicados en una tabla de usuarios.
code:
SELECT 
    email, 
    COUNT(email) as count
FROM 
    users
GROUP BY 
    email
HAVING 
    COUNT(email) > 1;

title: SQL: Upsert (Insert or Update)
description: Patrón PostgreSQL para insertar un registro o actualizarlo si ya existe (ON CONFLICT).
code:
INSERT INTO user_settings (user_id, theme, notifications)
VALUES (123, 'dark', true)
ON CONFLICT (user_id) 
DO UPDATE SET 
    theme = EXCLUDED.theme,
    notifications = EXCLUDED.notifications,
    updated_at = NOW();

title: R: Manipulación con Dplyr
description: Ejemplo de filtrado, agrupación y resumen de datos usando la librería dplyr.
code:
library(dplyr)

summary_df <- original_df %>%
  filter(status == 'active') %>%
  group_by(department) %>%
  summarise(
    avg_salary = mean(salary, na.rm = TRUE),
    count = n()
  ) %>%
  arrange(desc(avg_salary))

title: Python: Generador de Contraseñas
description: Script para generar passwords seguros con letras, números y símbolos.
code:
import secrets
import string

def generate_password(length=12):
    alphabet = string.ascii_letters + string.digits + string.punctuation
    password = ''.join(secrets.choice(alphabet) for i in range(length))
    return password

print(f"Tu password seguro: {generate_password(16)}")
